catModules: Quickly access common actions and modify objects.
Change the side of your character.
Revamped attributes menu for objects. Allows for greater control over object, vehicle, and AI states.
AI don't run out of magazines, set to a stance automatically, and have correct identities for the region.
Allows for changing a vehicle's pylons and vehicle appearance with an interface similar to the Virtual Garage's.
Allows for collapsing and expanding all trees in the placement tree, allows for vehicles to be placed without AI.
Dead bodies and vehicles will be automatically deleted when players are far away from them.
A fix for the Dynamic Groups system not initializing on players to ensure every player can press the U menu.
Easy Mode is a toggle. It sets the AI skill to the lowest possible and forces them to stand.
Garrisoning the AI will make them enter the nearest buildings and get in positions to defend it. Instant will teleport them to said positions, search will make the AI walk to their positions.
This module can remove or add NVGs, flashlights, and smoke grenades from all AI of a side.
These modules force all currently alive AI to turn on or off their lights or lasers on their gun.
This module transforms the AI its placed on into a hostage. They can be freed by players using a scroll action.
This module transforms the AI its place on into an HVT. When they are killed all players will be alerted of their death.
This module changes the current animation of the AI its placed on.
This module changes the skill level of all currently alive AI.
This module changes the stance of all currently alive AI and changes the default stance for future AI you place.
This module makes the AI its placed on suppress a position for a selected duration of time.
This module makes the AI careless or aware. When careless AI will not react to gunfire and will not flee the area.
This module makes the AI its placed on surrender, throwing their gun away and placing their hands on their head. Players can secure the surrendered AI.
Calls an airdrop to the selected position. You can select whether the airdrop is an arsenal or vehicle airdrop, the payload, direction of airdrop, aircraft type, and the side of the airdrop.

This module calls an evac helicopter to the position, select the direction the aircraft comes from, the side, the helicopter type, and the number of passengers (excluding crew) needed to leave. Then, select the destination point for the helicopter.

This module calls reinforcements of a specific faction to a position in a helicopter, they will land there and move to a secondary position on foot. You can select the direction they come from, number of units, and number of AT soldiers.
This module makes the object its placed onto an arsenal or spawns one at the position. The arsenal allows players to set respawn loadouts, rearm from their saved loadout, and edit their loadouts.

This module spawns M9-SD's AIO Arsenal.
Note: See the link for more documentation.
These modules spawn a helicopter crash at a randomized position around the map. These last for 15 minutes before despawning. After completion or despawn, another will spawn in 10 minutes.

These modules spawn a convoy mission (ONLY CONFIGURED FOR ALTIS). The objective is to eliminate the convoy crew and secure the truck before they reach their destination. Destroying the truck or allowing them to reach their destination is a failure. After completion or failure another will spawn after 10 minutes.
Note: If you would like to configure convoys for more maps, contact Expung3d on Discord.

This module will garrison a percentage of the town named or at the placed position with the side selected.
Note: High percentage of garrison on large towns can cause poor performance, use at your own risk.
This module deletes all dead bodies, destroyed buildings, empty groups, items on the ground, and jet canopies.
This module deletes all empty groups.
This module deletes every object, excluding Zeus logic and objectives.
This module deletes all map markers, including secure area objective markers.
This module deletes all protection zones.
This module deletes objects in the radius, excluding Zeus logic and objectives.
This module saves the built composition around a building and allows to be used later.
This module spawns a random saved composition onto the building it is placed onto.
This module does not work unless in 3den, it is only here for the function to be stored and used in the 3den editor.
This module when placed on a boat will create a Aircraft Carrier.
This module when placed on a boat will create a Destroyer.
This module will delete all Aircraft Carriers.
This module will delete all Destroyers.
This module when placed opens the Splendid Animation Viewer and opens to the animation of the unit its placed on.
This module when opens a local debug console.
This module when placed on an object opens the Config Viewer to that object's config.
This module when placed opens the Function Viewer.
This module when placed opens the GUI Editor.
This module changes the time without the useless ''x hours later...'' screen.
This module opens a menu that lets you change the weather conditions very specifically.
This module creates a minefield with a number of mines in a radius.
This module creates an IED that detonates when a specific side enters the radius.
This module creates an on-screen countdown for a specified side.
This module creates an on-screen countdown for a specified side.

This module sends a message with large text to specified sides.
Note: This uses a filter to prevent kicks on Official Servers, profanity will be removed.

This module sends a subtitle message to specified sides.
Note: This uses a filter to prevent kicks on Official Servers, profanity will be removed.
This module attaches the object its placed on to the nearest object to it.
This module detaches the object its placed on.
This module creates an interface that lets you modify the object its placed on. You can change textures, modify the init, lock it, etc.
This module replaces the object its placed on with a simple object that can be moved and rotated.
This module disables or enables the simulation of the object its placed on.
This module toggles god mode for the object its placed on.
These modules hide and unhide the objects it is placed on.
This module changes the side of the unit it is placed on.
This module removes all weapons from the unit its placed on.
This module will heal the unit its placed on. If its a player and they are incapacitated, it will revive them.
This module ejects the players from the vehicle its placed on.

This module mutes all players except Zeuses.
Note: This module has a cooldown. You can only mute every 5 minutes and they will be muted for a maximum of 1 minute.
This module changes the side relations. Example: Makes OPFOR friendly to BLUFOR.
This module prevents all players from entering and using mortars.
This module changes the amount of time needed to respawn.
This module changes the view distance for either just yourself (local) or everyone (global).
This module removes the team-killer attribute from all players.
I am far too lazy to make anything for this nor would it be useful or better than the default sound modules...
This module creates a fire on the module's position.
This module creates a smoke pillar on the module's position.
This module creates an earthquake that effects everyone.
This module turns off or on all lights in a radius from the module's position.
This module lets you lock and unlock doors on buildings.
This module makes fences within the radius god-moded so that they cannot be ran over if they are reasonably structurally sound.
This module hides terrain objects in a radius from the module's position.
This module teleports your character to the module's position. Although you are probably better of using RMB to teleport.
This module teleports all players to the module's position.
This module teleports a specific player to the module's position.
This module teleports all players of a specific side to the module's position.
This module adds ALL objects to the Zeus interface.
This module adds ALL objects within the radius to the Zeus interface.
This module toggles off the Auto-Add to Interface tool. When turned on everytime the Zeus interface is opened it will add all objects to the interface.
This module unflips the vehicle its placed on.
This module rearms the vehicle its placed on.
This module refuels the vehicle its placed on.
This module repairs the vehicle its placed on.
This module forces the Game Moderator into the Spectator screen so they cannot edit anything through Zeus.
This module allows the Game Moderator to have access to all items in Zeus and have full permissions.
